contents.value: Improve desktop layout
Linked to feedback that I received, I reworked the theme to have the menu always available when there is enough space (especially on desktop).
Add archived projects and finally rework on the router
I started this session to add old projects on the website and, 2 hours later, i finally reworked the way to manage the router and the sidepanel.
At the end the changes on project side is not fully finished... :(
Code review => Code improvements
After asking for feedback on linkedin, i received some comments about what i need to do to improve my code (thanks Axel, :D).
That was not a surprise, there was different things to fix and to improve.
Now the idea is to keep these changes in mind and stop to say that i will manage that later...
Note: forgot "forEach" if "map", "reduce" or "filter" is usable to manage your case.
Projects and Fix for mobile
The projects
I added the menu "Projects" to share info about my personal projects, but instead of rewrite things already visible on the README.md, i decided to fetch the info directly from Github.
The second advantage is that i will not have to update the info on this website if there are new things. \o/
Note: Only two projects for the moment. One or two more will come later after an update on their README file.
Fix issues on mobile
I didn't do some tests on mobile since few days and of course it was not optimized. Now that will be better (until the next check).
Cosmetic changes in code
I reorganize the code a little bit to not mix common components, pages and layout. That will be more easier to find a piece of code.
I change also the imports to use absolute path instead of relative path. That will help to understand from where come the imported code.
The website is online
I switch on the access to the website even if all is not finished. let's see later if it's a good idea or not.
I can always move back to the "under construction page" later if needed (maybe i will create a github action to switch on/off that).
React-router integration
I decided to integrate react-router on the site and seems i waited too lot to do that.
I had to refactor lot of things but the result is better than expected
Changes on the home page
As mentionned last time, I added two new things on the main page (a quick overview of the logbook and my github activities with the account 'Noofreuuuh')
Like each time this is a first version, improvement will come later. I just need to know if i will keep those two things there or not
About the logbook
I moved the content in a JSON file. That will reduce the number of lines in the TSX and i don't want to have to manage a database for that with CRUD,...
I worked a little bit on the ui. no big changes but a little bit less ugly.
New ideas
1- Create a section to publish some short articles
It comes after reading an article about linked list.
I think that write article can help me to more understood concept or new things.
Let's try that later.
2- Create a component to display github activities
Create a component to display github activities on the home page.
hint: https://api.github.com/users/Noofreuuuh/events
Add a logbook?? Why??
It might not be something original but, today, after working on this site playing with Material-ui, I decided to create this page.
The idea is simple.
Write a few words regularly about what I did, learned or discovered during the day or, if I am not doing it daily, the last few days.
Note 1: The current version of the logbook is ugly. Need to rethink it later
Note 2: Same for the background page.
Note 3: More globally, need to work on the theme.
